channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Blue States Embrace Fraud to Get Welfare for All
item.description: In states led by Democrats, the truly needy are being used as political pawns in a leftist game.

item.title: The Military Will Be Stronger for Pete Hegseth’s Commonsense Changes
item.description: The Pentagon is right to pursue a merit-based culture and high standards of physical fitness and training in order to deter and, if necessary, win war...

item.title: Hegseth Is Right — We Need To Rethink Women’s Role In The Military
item.description: Recruiting and retaining women in our military does not increase the number of sleepless nights for our foes.

item.title: Government shuts down after Congress deadlocks on spending deal
item.description: The federal government is entering a partial shutdown after Senate Democrats rebelled against a short-term spending bill.

item.title: White House pulls nomination of E.J. Antoni to lead Bureau of Labor Statistics
item.description: The White House late Tuesday withdrew the nomination of E. J. Antoni to serve as the next commissioner of the Bureau of Labor Statistics.

item.title: Investors dumped U.S. assets overnight in favor of gold, Bitcoin, and foreign stocks as government shutdown leaves Wall Street ‘flying blind’
item.description: The big question moving forward is, how long will the shutdown last?

item.title: Republicans push for constitutional amendment to dock lawmakers' pay during government shutdowns
item.description: Lawmakers are backing a proposal for a constitutional amendment to dock the pay of federal legislators when there is a government shut down.

item.title: Judge rules USPS ban on guns is unconstitutional
item.description: The U.S. Postal Service policy banning people from bringing firearms into post offices violates the Constitution, a federal judge in Texas ruled Tuesd...

item.title: Happy Gilmore 2: Golf and Unity
item.description: Sandler stares down Anderson.

item.title: The Show Trial of Jeffrey Clark
item.description: The push to disbar the Trump official for ‘attempted dishonesty’ is a scary clown show.

item.title: We’re not in an ‘AI winter’—but here’s how to survive a cold snap
item.description: Experts' strategies to steer AI investments wisely—and weather the chill.

item.title: DOJ Opens Probe Into Des Moines Schools As Illegal Alien Superintendent Resigns
item.description: DOJ says investigators will be looking into whether Iowa’s largest public school system is employing discriminatory DEI in hiring practices.

item.title: Yet another recession indicator is flashing as consumer confidence declines sharply in September
item.description: Consumer confidence has dropped below key thresholds, challenging Fed policymakers and Wall Street’s bullish market view.

item.title: Let’s talk about ARR
item.description: In VC and startups, there’s some ‘creative accounting’ going on amid the AI boom.

item.title: It Turns Out The Military’s Biden-Era Recruitment Crisis Was A Leadership Problem After All
item.description: For first time in a long time, service members have leaders who actually give a damn about the mission and their well-being.

item.title: IKEA’s new U.S. strategy: Amid tariffs and economic uncertainty, the furniture retailer is looking beyond the big blue box
item.description: The Swedish furniture chain is going bigger into the U.S.—by going smaller.
